Package com.example.noram

Class EventListFragmentTemplate

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.noram.EventListFragmentTemplate
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
Direct Known Subclasses:
AttendeeEventListFragment, OrganizerEventListFragment
public abstract class EventListFragmentTemplate extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
A template Fragment for event lists. Should be used to create fragments that contain lists of events
Author:
Gabriel

  • Method Details

    • onResume

      public void onResume()
      This method is called when the fragment is resumed. It hides the search ListView by default.
      Overrides:
      onResume in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

    • setReferenceSearchList

      protected void setReferenceSearchList(ArrayList<Event> newList)
      Changes the reference list (on which searches are performed) for a new list
      Parameters:
      newList - The new list on which searches will now be performed

    • setupSearch

      protected void setupSearch(android.widget.ListView searchList, android.widget.EditText searchInput)
      Setup the ListView and EditText passed so that any text entered in the EditText will show the ListView with corresponding search results, pulled from the database
      Parameters:
      searchList - The ListView that will display search results
      searchInput - The EditText that will take user input for searches

    • showSearchList

      protected void showSearchList()
      Hook that shows the searchList view on the screen. Override to hide other views that could be blocking the list from being visible

    • hideSearchList

      protected void hideSearchList()
      Hook that hides the searchList view on the screen. Override to show the other views that need to be visible

    • searchElementsClick

      protected abstract void searchElementsClick(Event event)
      Hook that is called when a view in the searchList view is clicked on
      Parameters:
      event - The event that was clicked on (in the searchList)
